bug.short_desc: Transmission fails to start after installing from the Software app - missing dependency?
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Fedora; Linux x86_64; rv:50.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/50.0 Build Identifier:
Install Transmission app from the Software application.
Installed ok.
Tried to run it by clicking it icon in Gnome under 'Show Applications'.
Transmission fails to run - application loading cursor appears for a while - then nothing.
Run from a Terminal windows with command: 'transmission-gtk' and get error:
"transmission-gtk: error while loading shared libraries: libnatpmp.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory"
To fix - install missing library with: sudo dnf install libnatpmp
Re-run command: 'transmission-gtk' - runs ok
Reproducible: Didn't try
Steps to Reproduce: See Details text for steps taken and outcome Actual Results: See Details text for steps taken and outcome
Expected Results: See Details text for steps taken and outcome
uname -a == Linux 4.8.14-300.fc25.x86_64 #1 SMP Mon Dec 12 16:31:04 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
